results.title: Gulf Country
results.brief_description: The country in Northern Australia bordering on the Gulf of Carpentaria is a flat, dry area in which the rivers and creeks seldom run and isolated water holes keep the wild life and stock alive. At the time when gold was being mined there several townships were flourishing but these are largely abandoned. The Mitchell River Mission looks after aborigines of the district who are free to come and go as they please, and some are employed on the cattle runs in the area. At the waterholes may be seen large flocks of ibis and many other birds as well as wild pigs and crocodiles. At times the sky is darkened by flights of flying foxes.

results.title: Guitar: From stone age through solid rock
results.creator_credit: Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Lee Mishkin

results.title: Guitar Made Easy
results.creator_credit: Marc Gardiner, Paul Fenech and Hugh Kidd

results.title: Guitar legends: the ultimate anthology
results.brief_description: This disc contains twelve songs from an array of British rock groups, presenting the influence of guitar, and guitarists on popular music, through an array of live performances. The tracks are: Paul Kosso/Free “Alright now”; Andy Powell/Wishbone Ash “Phoenix”; Robin Trower “Night of the guitars”; Ritchie Blackmore/Deep Purple “Improvisation”; Rory Gallagher “Could have had religion”; John Etheridge/Soft Machine “Tale of Taliesin ; Jan Akermann/Focus “Hocus pocus”; Vernon Reed/Jack Bruce “Sunshine of your love”; Steve Hackett “Clocks” ; Steve Howe “Clap”; Mick Box/Uriah Heep “The Magician’s birthday”; Tony Iommi/Black Sabbath “Headless cross”.

results.title: Guitar
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video School of Music Series”.
With this series you can be taught professionally in your own home. You can replay difficult sections and of course have the same lesson over and over again. This video takes you through the basics of guitar playing with Steve Crofts, a protege of George Goller. Rated: G

results.title: Guitar
results.creator_credit: Barbara Willis Sweete and Niv Fichman
results.brief_description: A vibrant kaleidoscope of Toronto’s International Guitar Festival, “Guitar” meshes dance, mime, visual art and virtuoso performances to create a spectacular and yet intimate celebration of the instrument. For one exciting week the city of Toronto is transformed into the guitar centre of the world. The streets echo with the sounds of the instrument as the great masters from every tradition gather to play for each other - John Williams, Leo Brouwer, Steve Morse to name but a few.

results.title: Guinea pigs is pigs
results.brief_description: Entertaining treatment of bureaucracy at its worst, based on the short story “pigs is pigs” by Ellis parker Butler. A stationmaster, who goes by the rules and insists that “guinea pigs is pigs” and therefore must travel at a higher freight rate than domestic animals, is left to content with a rapidly expanding guinea pig populations and the pater warfare of the railway administration.

results.title: Guinea pigs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “About Animals”.
Children learn that guinea pigs are affectionate animals who seem to like being with people and are easy to care for and handle. Basic facts about selective breeding are introduced as the children observe the varied colourings and markings of guinea pigs.

results.title: Guinea gold
results.brief_description: This film presents the early history of the Bulolo goldfields in the northwestern part of what is known today as the Territory of Papua New Guinea. The gold prospectors were the explorers of this rugged country mandated to Australia by the League of Nations. The film records primitive native life of the area as it was discovered by them - a people with unique customs living in a stone-age environment. Shows the discovery of alluvial gold in the Bulolo Valley and the construction of the first dredges, every part of which was flown in three tons at a time over the mountains from Lae in three-engined Junkers aircraft. The role of the aircraft is shown to be basic in the development of the resources of the Bulolo Valley, and the valley itself with its wealth of alluvial gold was a basic part of the economic and industrial development of pre-war New Guinea.

results.title: Guilty chimneys
results.brief_description: Deals with the urgent problem of smoke-abatement. The film shows how smoking coal fires not only waste fuel, but also cause dirt and corrosion, and bring about fogs and illness. Various methods of smoke-elimination in the home and industry are outlined, in particular the wider use of gas and coke; and the establishment of new smokeless zone together with extension of existing ones is advocated.
